item.title: Avoiding Tanks on Small Islands
item.description: A WWII account explaining why soldiers never positioned themselves in front of tanks on small islands, highlighting tactical decisions and battlefield safety measures.

media:content.media:title: Avoiding Tanks on Small Islands
media:content.media:description: A WWII account explaining why soldiers never positioned themselves in front of tanks on small islands, highlighting tactical decisions and battlefield safety measures.

item.title: WWII Veteran Joseph R. Picard’s Journey Home
item.description: WWII veteran Joseph R. Picard recounts his journey home, arriving on Christmas Eve, and the early-morning crew preparing a holiday meal for returning soldiers.

item.title: WWII Veteran in the Battle of the Bulge
item.description: WWII veteran Irving Locker recounts providing air and artillery support during the Battle of the Bulge, helping Allied troops resist Germany’s final major offensive.

item.title: WWII P-51 Pilot Meets F-16 Pilot
item.description: A meeting between a World War II P-51 pilot and a modern F-16 pilot, highlighting aviation history, technological evolution, and shared experiences in military flight.

item.title: Purpose of the Flamethrower in WWII
item.description: An examination of how flamethrowers were used in World War II, exploring their tactical role, effectiveness, and impact on combat operations.

item.title: The Real Faces of “Black Hawk Down”
item.description: Highlighting the untold stories and experiences of those involved in the real “Black Hawk Down” incident, honoring their service and sacrifices.

item.title: Little-Known WWII Rifle Used by Marines
item.description: Exploring a lesser-known rifle carried by Marines during World War II, detailing its design, use in combat, and role in military history.

item.title: Fallujah: Intense Iraq War Battle
item.description: An in-depth look at the Battle of Fallujah, one of the most intense conflicts of the Iraq War, highlighting combat, strategy, and the experiences of soldiers on the front lines.

item.title: Wounded and Left Behind in Vietnam
item.description: A firsthand account of a soldier wounded and stranded in the jungles of Vietnam, highlighting survival, resilience, and the challenges faced during the war.

item.title: Inside a Body Bag: Vietnam Experience
item.description: A firsthand account of the complex and challenging roles faced by soldiers in Vietnam, exploring the emotional and practical realities of wartime duties.

item.title: WWII Veteran Don Graves Sings at Valor Conference
item.description: 100-year-old Iwo Jima veteran Don Graves performs “God Bless America” at the 28th American Valor Conference, honoring his service and legacy.

item.title: Did God Save My Life on D-Day?
item.description: A personal account from a D-Day veteran reflecting on survival, faith, and the extraordinary experiences faced during the Normandy invasion of World War II.

item.title: Navy SEAL Jason Redman Ambush Survival
item.description: The story of Navy SEAL Jason Redman, who survived being shot seven times in an ambush, showcasing his resilience, recovery, and dedication to service.

item.title: Origin of "When I Have Your Wounded"
item.description: The story behind the phrase used by Vietnam Dustoff pilots, highlighting the courage and dedication of medevac crews rescuing wounded soldiers under fire.

item.title: D-Day: Stories from the 101st Airborne
item.description: Firsthand accounts from soldiers of the 101st Airborne on D-Day, sharing their experiences, challenges, and bravery during the pivotal Normandy invasion.

item.title: From Precision to Pattern Bombing in WWII
item.description: An analysis of the shift from precision to pattern bombing during World War II, examining strategy, effectiveness, and the impact on military operations and civilians.

item.title: The Hidden Tragedy of World War II
item.description: An exploration of lesser-known events and personal stories from World War II, highlighting the human cost and untold hardships experienced during the conflict.

item.title: Marine Captain Geoff Ball in Kabul Evacuation
item.description: Marine Captain Geoff Ball led Ghost Company during the Kabul evacuation, facing an ISIS-K attack that killed 13 U.S. service members and dozens of Afghan civilians.

item.title: Founding Member of the 160th SOAR
item.description: A firsthand account from a founding member of the 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment, detailing the unit’s formation, missions, and contributions to military aviation.

item.title: Facing Combat in a Sherman Tank
item.description: A historical look at soldiers operating a Sherman tank in combat, highlighting tactics, challenges, and the realities of armored warfare during World War II.
